answer:
**Frame‐by‐Frame Analysis**  
• **Frame 1 and Frame 2**: The roadway is multi‐lane, divided by a raised median. There are no immediately visible speed‐limit signs at this distance; the most prominent features are the residential fencing to the left and the “Fairway Ridge” sign on the right.  
• **Frame 3**: A small, square‐shaped signpost (just ahead on the right) starts to come into clearer view, but the text is not yet fully legible.  
• **Frame 4**: That same sign is now more readable—it shows a rectangular shape typical of a speed limit sign, and appears to say “40.”  
• **Frame 5**: The sign is clearly identifiable as a **Speed Limit 40** sign alongside the right curb.  

**Contextual Reasoning**  
Across Frames 1 to 3, you see the sign in the distance. By Frame 4 and especially Frame 5, the “Speed Limit 40” text comes into clear view. No other speed limit postings are seen in frames before that sign.

**Match to Answer Choices**  
(A) 30, (B) 35, or (D) 45 would contradict the plainly visible “Speed Limit 40” sign in Frame 4 and Frame 5. Hence, (C) 40 mph is the correct limit.

<answer>C. 40 mph.</answer>
